title: Mike Gonzales
text:
Mike Gonzales is a former <a href="United%20States">United States</a> <a href="Decathlon">decathlete</a>.
Gonzales attended <a href="Bishop%20Montgomery%20High%20School">Bishop Montgomery High School</a> in Redondo Beach, California, where he played both <a href="American%20football">football</a> and <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a>. He was inducted into the school's Athletic Hall of Fame in 2013.
Gonzales was offered multiple football <a href="scholarships">scholarships</a> to play at top universities. He accepted a full scholarship in <a href="Track%20and%20Field">Track and Field</a> from <a href="University%20of%20Southern%20California">University of Southern California</a> with the intention of becoming an Olympic athlete. At USC Gonzales was a standout in decathlon, where he held the USC Decathlon School record from 1984-2019. He competed and won the gold medal in decathlon at the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201987%20Pan%20American%20Games">1987 Pan American Games</a> in Indiana.
Gonzales tried four times to make the USA Olympic Team in Decathlon (1984 1988, 1992,1996) but was plagued by injury in each attempt. Gonzales was recruited by Olympian <a href="Liston%20Bochette">Liston Bochette</a> to participate in the <a href="1998%20Winter%20Olympics">1998 Winter Olympics</a> representing <a href="Puerto%20Rico">Puerto Rico</a> in the four-man bobsled team.
Gonzales later became a competitive amateur golfer, competing in over 400 tournaments. In 2016 Mike Gonzales began to complete as a professional golfer, completing in Champion Tour Event qualifiers and 3 of the Champion Tour Qualifying School Tournaments. Today he is the CEO for TOPIMR, a web-based Internet Marketing Company.
Personal life.
Gonzales resides in Southern California with his wife, Debra and his son Tanner.
